newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakh jet insurance broker clarifying liabilities.
newsitem.headline: Kazakh jet insurance broker clarifying liabilities.

text.p: Alexander Howden Aviation, the broker which places insurance cover for Kazakhstan's state airline, said on Wednesday it was trying to establish insurance details for the Kazakh cargo plane which collided with a Saudi jumbo killing some 350 people.
A spokesman for the company said that as it was a charter flight, it is not clear who assumes responsibility.
The Kazakhstan National Airways (KazAir) plane was chartered to Kosmokraft, a trading company from neighbouring Kyrgyzstan, Kazakh transport officials said.
Search teams found the flight data and cockpit voice recorders of the cargo plane on Wednesday which crashed 80 km (50 miles) from New Delhi on Tuesday.
Alexander Howden Aviation, a division of the Alexander Howden Group Ltd based in Britain, places insurance for some of the troubled Kazakh state airline's aircraft.

Dogged by financial problems, KazaAir was formally closed down in August after being criticised by the government for falling safety standards and running up debts of $149 million. A new air company is in the process of registration.
